name: Welgelegen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived when every effort was made to get our room ready early to the time we left we found everydody at the Guest House from the owner to the gardener very polite and attentive.
reviews.title: Great Location, friendly and helpful staff, nothing was too much trouble

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: The standard of the breakfast was excellent. The additional touches of fresh fruit and flowers in our very attractive and clean bedroom together with a jar of cookies and a small bottle of port was a most welcome surprise.
reviews.title: Fantastic luxury with friendly feeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In the evening a selection of nibbles, port and sherry was provided free if required.
reviews.title: Can't imagine a nicer place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chocolates at bedtime was also a nice touch from such a small establishment as was the newsletter put under your door with an up to date weather forecast.
reviews.title: Excellent guesthouse with exemplary service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location was also ideal for access to Cape Town and several good restaurants whilst providing tranquility of a comfortable lounge or pleasant courtyard after a busy day.
reviews.title: 14 Family members descend on Welgelegen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just got back from a 2-1/2 week trip to South Africa that started with 6 nights at the Welgelegen guest house in Capetown. Fiona and Anine and the entire staff were welcoming, warm, informative, funny & charming, and above all, extremely helpful in every way. The rooms are lovely and comfortable, the breakfasts are delicious (fresh fruit, yogurt, granola or hot breakfast choices), the common areas are conducive to chatting with other guests (something my family likes to do--but there are enough places to sit quietly and read if you want as well), the location is in easy walking distance of Kloof St with galleries, shops & restaurants, the art work throughout is stunning. And they were happy to accomodate any request: a massage for a bad shoulder, an early breakfast, a late-night snack. In short--Welgelegen was the perfect place to start our South African adventure. We truly felt at home and would return in a second.
reviews.title: home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: initially stayed five nights and were impressed enough to return another 2. Super location for downtown and all the major attractions. Our room had a balcony over looking Table Mountain. Stunning views. Elegant lounge area was always open to welcome you at any time of day or night. Similarly the dining room area was beautifully appointed with local wine and port available in the early evening.
reviews.title: Home from home comfort,excellent staff,help and advice always on tap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were excellent and always on hand to assist with any queries, helped with route planning, local information etc. They always went the extra mile even providing extended hospitality on our last day as our flight was at mdnight. Fiona, Anine, Danielle, Rita and her staff will give you a warm welcome and do everything to ensure you have an enjoyable stay in Cape Town. Customer service at its best! Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful, pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Welgelegen Guest House was a wonderful recommended by our travel agent. We spent four nights before starting a week long safari. This was a perfect start to our trip and a great place to stay while in Cape Town. Our guest room was large and comfortable. The living areas very nice and the courtyard and plunge pool a tranquil place for a respite during the afternoon. The staff was friendly, very accommodating and professional. Breakfast was a wide range of food with a lovely buffet as well as the food to order. We loved our stay and look forward to our return.
reviews.title: The best of the best in Cape Town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Through a friend in Cape Town, I discovered Welgelegen Guest House 5 years ago; and have since stayed there many times. It is not possible to say enough nice things about the comfort of the rooms and how accommodating the staff is, in particular Anine, Danielle and Fiona, who has the good fortune to own the guest house.
reviews.title: Welgelegen is a luxurious historical guest house with the perfect location in the Cape Town city bowl

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all of our travels this is one of the best places to stay. The location is perfect with a great view of Table Mountain and walking distance to restaurants. It was a great place to come home to at the end of the day. Clean, classy and comfortable with a friendly staff and the best breakfast in the world! If you stay here you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Smiling staff, excellent breakfasts and a glass of wine or port on offer as a nightcap in front of the fireplace. Perfect for a winter's night in Africa! I stayed there twice (1st visit for three nights and 2nd visit for one night) and enjoyed it each time, particularly as this was the first time I had ever stayed in a Guesthouse. I think it could more properly be called a boutique hotel or a Luxury Guesthouse...as I have exacting standards (a Relais & Chateaux/Ritz Carlton kinda woman)...and it did not fit with my pre-conceived notion of a guesthouse (I pictured a place that was a bit run-down and grotty, but the reality couldn't have been farther from this).
reviews.title: Charming, friendly guesthouse with comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each room is decorated differently with an eye to comfort and to a high standard. I had an excellent view of Table Mountain from Room 10. As it was winter, they had a hot water bottle in my bed, waiting for me when I returned from my ramblings in the evening.
reviews.title: Fantastic last night in Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend that they have a discreet laptop/comptuer available in the front living room for people to check their email, although you can use a computer in the office if you ask Danielle or Anine, the day managers. They are happy to organize day-trips for you, as Danielle pulled together a Full-Day tour for me in about 15 minutes, getting me one of the last spots on the African Eagle tour to the Cape of Good Hope. For dining/entertainment, the Guesthouse is just around the corner from the top of Kloof Street/Long Street with its many restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would happily recommend this Guesthouse to other travellers, and it has opened my eyes to the possibilities of staying in Guesthouses from now on when I travel.
reviews.title: Calm and serene in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to South Africa for our honeymoon and our first stop was Welgelegen. We arrived late at night and were greeted and showed our room. Our room was very nicely decorated, clean and welcoming. Breakfast was incredible! Delicious homemade breads, fruit, eggs, cereal, coffee, tea, juice, cheese, etc. We took a peak at the other rooms which were all well designed and beautiful. The design of the common areas looked like it was from a magazine- very nice decor. Our room opened up to Table Mountain and we had a perfect view. The staff was excellent and the location was perfect- within walking distance (if you like to walk) to some of the well known street of that area- Greenmarket Square and Longview. We were also a short taxi ride away from the base of table mountain. Overall I LOVED Welglegen and when we go back to South Africa we will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So handy for eating, whether in a local simple restaurant or a treat to the Mount Nelson. We walked everywhere day and night and particularly loved the walk through Government Gardens. The car was not used while we were there.
reviews.title: Welgelegen is in a great location with super rooms and great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fiona, Danielle, Annine and all the staff cant do enough for you. We are now booking for our next trip later this year
reviews.title: a warm welcome awaits you here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just enjoyed a wonderful one week stay at the Welgelegen. The welcome we received from all the staff, in particular Anine, was incredible and made us feel very at home.
reviews.title: Should be rated number 1, not 27th!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well situated and all the rooms are very well designed and decorated.
reviews.title: Old school comfort in a trendy location

description: "Welgelegen - an urban sanctuary in the heart of Cape Town".
